title: Avoid commented-out dead code in pull requests
description: Commented-out blocks of code make the codebase harder to read and maintain.
fix: Remove commented-out code or move it to version control history or documentation.

title: No debug logging or print statements in committed code
description: Temporary debug logging (e.g., print, console.log) should not ship to production.
fix: Remove debug statements or replace them with proper logging at an appropriate log level.

title: Avoid wide-ranging try/except or catch-all error handling
description: Catching broad exceptions (e.g., bare `except`, `Exception`) can hide real bugs and make debugging difficult.
fix: Catch specific exception types and handle them explicitly; let unexpected errors surface.

title: Detect and avoid duplicated logic or copy-paste blocks
description: Duplicated logic increases maintenance cost and the risk of inconsistent fixes.
fix: Recommend extracting common logic into a shared function, method, or module.

title: Respect function and file size for readability
description: Very large functions or files are harder to understand and maintain.
fix: Suggest splitting large functions/files into smaller, focused units with clear responsibilities.

title: LLM providers must not create clients directly
description: LLM providers should not construct their own HTTP or API clients (e.g., openai.New..., http.Client{}). They must receive them via dependency injection.
fix: Request the client from the dependency injection system instead of creating it directly.

title: No runtime type assertions on concrete providers
description: Avoid runtime type assertions on concrete provider types. Use stable interfaces instead.
fix: Refactor to use interfaces or abstractions to access provider components and their methods.
